title: Gapless boundary drift on format transitions (opus→FLAC)
description:
When transitioning from opus transcoded files to FLAC files, gapless boundary prediction fails due to format mismatch in buffer calculations.

Root cause: Boundary calculation assumes uniform byte-to-time conversion across entire buffer, but when buffer contains mixed formats (opus tail + FLAC head), the prediction becomes inaccurate.

Symptoms:
- SimpleTracker jumps backwards (-155.81s advancement)
- Prediction errors up to ±16 seconds
- STMs sent early (while previous track still playing) or late (already into next track)
- 131-second buffer gaps between write/read positions

Technical details:
- Write-Read gap: 50636840 bytes (131.867 seconds ahead)
- Track boundary reached at 42.33s but predicted for 41.49s
- SimpleTracker went from 198.12s (opus overrun) to 42.31s (FLAC start)

Files affected: AudioStreamDecoder.swift boundary calculation logic

Priority: High - affects gapless playback reliability on format transitions
